_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES:



Passive release prevention efforts include placement of storage tanks. The anhydrous ammonia tanks are located at the rear of the property where they are unlikely to be struck by vehicles. 



Active prevention measures include inspection of all tanks at the beginning and end of each season.  All required repairs are performed at that time, prior to further use. Further inspection are performed semi annually by the Missouri Dept of Agriculture, Weights and Measures.



Emergency response policies are as described below:



FACILITY DESCRIPTION AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE HANDLED



The facility is located on the Southwest edge of Sedalia, Mo and supplies fertilizer to farmers.The facility has 2 tanks with capabilities of 26,000 and 11,000 gallons respectively, we also store nurse tanks at this location.



WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIOS AND ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIOS



The worst case release scenario for the ammonia operation envisions a catastrophic failure of the storage tank possibly preceded by failure of the safety relief valves.  Regulatory and procedural controls limit the amount of anhydrous in the tank to 85% of tank capacity.  Using RMP*COMP, the toxic endpoint was calculated to be at 3.6 miles.  This would include virtually the entire city of Sedalia.



Alternative release scenario involve a broken hose allowing product to escape.  The toxic endpoint for such a release is 0.5 miles.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM



The facility complies with 29CFR 1910.111 (anhydrous ammonia)



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There have been no accidents involving release of anhydrous ammonia in the last five years.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



This facility is located within the city limits of Sedalia, Missouri.  Employees will notify the fire department in the event of a major release.  The general Manager and other designated employees are authorized to take appropriate actions to st

op small releases by shutting off valves, etc.  Other employees will notify the fire department and evacuate the area as necessary.  There is a written emergency response plan in place that is for the use and applies only to company employees.  This plan includes evacuation procedures, who is to authorize emergency, actions to be taken to control a release, notification and alarm procedures and other necessary information.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



There are currently no change to the safety/release prevention program planned.
